navbarTooltipLongClickShareOnMain: Long click to share on main
errSignUpPassword: The password must contain at least 8 characters and a number
cutFormPdbCodeTooltip: PDB code as it appears in the Protein Databank
cutFormCheckboxToolip: Select to upload your own PDB file
cutFormChainTooltip: Name of the chain to choose from (leave as 'A' if not sure)
cutFormStartTooltip: First amino acid of the loop
cutFormEndTooltip: Last amino acid of the loop
cutFormSegmentEndWarning: Must be positive and bigger than segment start
cutFormHighRangeWarning: Range 16 or more amino acids might take a long time to compute
cutFormHighRangeError: Range of 30 or more amino acids is not allowed
cutFormLowRangeError: The range must contain at least 4 amino acids
errDegreeRange: Torsion angle has to be between 180 and -180
torsionFormTooltipShareOnMain: Tick to share your result on the homepage

errCodes.101: Targeting and constraining the same φ (phi) torsion
errCodes.102: Targeting and constraining the same ψ (psi) torsion
errCodes.103: Zero degrees of freedom, cannot target
errCodes.110: There may be a break in chain
errCodes.200: No PDB code or own PDB file provided
errCodes.202: Start and end of a segment must be positive integers with start being a smaller number than the end
errCodes.205: No segment with this ID exists
errCodes.206: No transform with this ID exists
errCodes.207: Target torsions are in incorrect format
errCodes.208: Constrained torisons are in incorrect format
errCodes.209: Provided PDB file is in wrong format
errCodes.312: Use with this email already exists

errLocalStorageUnavailable: Local storage not available; some functionality may not work properly.
homeSubtitle: This website has been created to simplify the process of protein loop homology modelling using a linear inverse-kinematics approach to target loops' torsions to desired values. This page contains transformed protein segments. Please refer to the tutorial page for more details.
homePaperRef: The tool is based on a paper by Hayward, S. and Kitao, A. (2010): The effect of end constraints on protein loop kinematics, Biophysical Journal, 98:1976-1985
